page.title: 13FARMING (AMAETHYDDIAETH)
page.content: The 7 farms in our area range from 600-1000 ft. They are all family farms working together & have been passed on from father to son for generations. It is a very high rainfall area, the hilly land is very steep and has been ploughed & seeded from old bracken to fertilized pasture. The farming is of sheep & beef cattle. The ewes used for breeding are Welsh Hill Speckled Face & Welsh Mountain. They are crossed with lowland rams for fat lamb production. This year many lambs have died from pneumonia. The cows are very important too. The Welsh black suckler cows are crossed with continental breeds which are sold as store cattle. The fishing rights on the Dyfi are owned by The Royal Prince Albert, Macclesfield. Many large barns & new farm hill roads have been constructed.
